Trails.Name: Lower Wanderer, West Meadows, Mike's Way
Old Log Rd, West Meadows, Mike's Way
Sun Bowl, Home Run, 91, Main Base Area

_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
12/29 2:44PM - Safe to say Stratton had quite the 64th birthday! All things considered, our Mountain Operations team worked around the clock through challenging conditions to deliver the best possible experience. This morning, 10 lifts were spinning with access to all open terrain shortly after opening. If you happen to see a member of the Operations team, thank them for all the hard work they do to keep us up and running!

Looking ahead to tomorrow, temperatures are expected to drop, with summit temperatures forecasted between 0-4 degrees and base temperatures between 9-13 degrees. We are planning to have 12 lifts scheduled to spin at 8:30am; however, high winds with gusts up to 50mph are in the forecast and wind delays are expected. Early access will be available for First Tracks pass holders, conditions permitting.

For your way down, we plan on having 58 trails open, all of which are scheduled to be groomed overnight. East Byrnes Side may begin the day on a delay as we evaluate features and conditions in the morning. Due to the expected cold temperatures, strong winds and firm surface conditions, beginner skiing and riding from the summit is not recommended tomorrow.

Colder temperatures moving in and sticking around will allow snowmaking and resurfacing operations to begin late tonight and continue over the next several days as our team works to prepare the mountain for the New Year.

Rest up and Ill see you bright and early for your morning update.

Shuttle Services Update: The only shuttles that will operate today are: Rising Bear, Hearthstone, Founders, Stratton Springs, Bear Creek, Lot 1, Lot 2, Green Apron and Sun Bowl.

Activities Update: Tubing, Ice Skating, Snowmobile Tours to the summit, and Snow-Go Tours are closed for the day. Mini-Z and Beginner Snowmobile Tours will be operating out of the main base area tonight. Climb is open with extended hours to 8pm.

Safety Tip: Stay on the groomed portion of trails. 

Hungry? Luckily for you, Holiday week is in full swing with extended dining hours, live music, and special events keeping the Village looking lively. Check out our Holiday Week Dining, Aprs & Live Music Guide to see what's open, happening, and where the music is at.

The Holidays have arrived at Stratton! The Village is decorated with lights and the schedule is decked with events. Aprs heats up with live music at Grizzly's, cozy nights at Paint & Sip, and festive fun rolling all week long into a stacked lineup of New Years celebrations. Ring it in your way with family dinners, dancing it out at the Silent Disco, hiking up for a one of a kind fireworks view, or watching the fireworks light up the mountain from the base area. Theres something for everyone this Holiday week and we couldnt be more excited to celebrate with you! Click here to check out the upcoming Events Calendar.

Stay and relish the Green Mountains! Stratton Real Estate is here to help with all your real estate needs. Make your sweet escape a reality.

Reliable cars are the name of the game; that is why we trust Oliver Subaru and Ford. Made for all seasons and all families, check out Oliver Ford and Oliver Subaru for year-round reliability.
